adjective.description: Not making or accompanied by any sound.
examples: the woods were still and silent
synonyms: so quiet you could hear a pin drop

phrases: This is a most regrettable decision and accepting the fact they have put the document out to publication, they have chosen to ignore the silent majority of patients, he said.
Fleming laments that existing surveys and studies have documented something about the vocal minority, but almost nothing about the silent majority.
Could this pick up the protest vote from the silent majority?
They are the silent majority who have never spoken until now.
A little restraint will also help to listen more carefully to the disquieting, but meaningful, silence of the silent majority.
origin: Late 15th century (in the sense not speaking): from Latin silent- being silent, from the verb silere.
